intro: Navarretia intertexta var. alpina, commonly known as the Sierra starflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of California and Nevada. It is a low-growing annual herb that typically reaches heights of 10 to 30 centimeters. The plant produces clusters of small, star-shaped white or pale blue flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, often forming a basal rosette. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to the harsh conditions of high-altitude environments.
